clinical_study.official_title: The Use of Mucolytic Solution Before Upper Endoscopy: A Randomized, Double-blinded Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Study was designed to evaluate efficacy of mucolytic solution ingested before upper endoscopy on visibility of gastric mucosa.

detailed_description.textblock: Residual gastric content containing mucus, bubbles, bile and food particles may limit visibility of gastric mucosa and therefore diagnostic yield of upper endoscopy, especially in cases of early neoplastic lesions. Data on benefit of peroral mucolytic solution administered before upper endoscopy are limited.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: "Visibility score" evaluated by blinded performing endoscopist
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 months
primary_outcome.description: "Visibility score" (0-25 points) counted as the sum of visibility score in the esophagus (0-5), fundus (0-5), corpus (0-5) and atrum (0-5) of the stomach and in the duodenum (0-5).

secondary_outcome.measure: "Visibility score" evaluated by three blinded endoscopists using 11 endoscopic images captured during endoscopy.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 3 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age > 18 years
- signed informed consent
- diagnostic gastroscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- age < 18 years
- interventional gastroscopy
- known disease of the upper GI tract and/or history of surgery of GI tract
- gastroscopy indicated of bleeding, dysphagia or ileus
- liver cirrhosis
- general anesthesia
